TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The SfListView control represents the data in interactive hierarchical structure interface across different layouts or views,
            that also has features such as data-binding, template, grouping and virtualization.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Component for executing complex list items common functionalities.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">The generic type parameter.</typeparam>
            <summary>
            Configure member properties of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfListView control represents the data in interactive hierarchical structure interface across different layouts or views,
            that also has features such as data-binding, template, grouping and virtualization.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `ID` property is used as a key to identify our element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Update child content from parent component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `Animation` property provides an option to apply different
             animations to the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Animation settings such as effect, duration and easing.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CheckBoxPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `CheckBoxPosition` is used to set the position of the check box in a list item.
            By default, the `checkBoxPosition` is Left, which will appear before the text content in a list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Set the position of the check box in a list item.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `CssClass` property is used to add a user-preferred class name in the root element of the ListView,
             using which you can customize the component (both CSS and functionality customization).
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of component. The default value is empty.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `DataSource` provides the data to render the ListView component which is mapped with the fields of ListView.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `Enabled` is set to true, the list items will be enabled. 
            You can disable the component using this property by setting its value as false.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, allows the user to interact with component. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the persistence can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `EnableVirtualization` is set to true, the ListViews performance will improve when loading a large amount of data.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the virtualization can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTitle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `HeaderTitle` is used to set the title of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is empty.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the height of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `HtmlAttributes` allows additional attributes such as id, class, etc., and
             accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional HTML attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `Query` is used to fetch specific data from the data source by using the where and select keywords.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The query used with the `where` and `select` keywords.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowCheckBox` is set to true, the checkbox will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the checkbox should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowHeader
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowHeader` is set to true, the header of the ListView component will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the header should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowIcon` is set to true, the icon of the list item will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the icon should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `SortOrder` is used to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are,
             `None` - The data source will not be sorted.
             `Ascending` - The data source will be sorted in ascending order.
             `Descending` - The data source will be sorted in descending order.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the width of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView has an option to custom design the group header title with the help of the groupTemplate property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView has an option to custom design the ListView header title with the help of the headerTemplate property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Template
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView supports customizing the content of each list item with the help of template property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

            The `HeaderTitle` is used to set the title of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is empty.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the height of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `HtmlAttributes` allows additional attributes such as id, class, etc., and
             accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional HTML attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `Query` is used to fetch specific data from the data source by using the where and select keywords.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The query used with the `where` and `select` keywords.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowCheckBox` is set to true, the checkbox will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the checkbox should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowHeader
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowHeader` is set to true, the header of the ListView component will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the header should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If `ShowIcon` is set to true, the icon of the list item will  be shown or hidden.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the icon should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The `SortOrder` is used to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are,
             `None` - The data source will not be sorted.
             `Ascending` - The data source will be sorted in ascending order.
             `Descending` - The data source will be sorted in descending order.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the width of the ListView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView has an option to custom design the group header title with the help of the groupTemplate property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView has an option to custom design the ListView header title with the help of the headerTemplate property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Template
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ListView supports customizing the content of each list item with the help of template property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Authorization.AuthorizeRouteView
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
             Combines the behaviors of <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Authorization.AuthorizeView" /> and <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.RouteView" />,
             so that it displays the page matching the specified route but only if the user
             is authorized to see it.
            
             Additionally, this component supplies a cascading parameter of type <see cref="T:System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1" />,
             which makes the user's current authentication state available to descendants.
             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: NotAuthorized
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The content that will be displayed if the user is not authorized.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Authorizing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The content that will be displayed while asynchronous authorization is in progress.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Resource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The resource to which access is being controlled.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RouteData
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the route data. This determines the page that will be
            displayed and the parameter values that will be supplied to the page.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DefaultLayout
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the type of a layout to be used if the page does not
            declare any layout. If specified, the type must implement <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.IComponent" />
            and accept a parameter named <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.LayoutComponentBase.Body" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Button Group Button component is creates a button component which is a graphical user interface that helps to triggers an event on its click action. 
            It can contain a text, an icon, svg or both. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            The button content is either by specifying <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property or by specifying content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the button is disabled or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the component is selected or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component is selected. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the name of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Name" /> property is used to set the name attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the value of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Value" /> property is used to set the value attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the toggle option is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the primary style is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. Left Center Right ]]>

In the below code example, a basic DropDownButton component initialized with and tag directives. ]]> DropDownButton component is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. DropDownButton component is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. DropDownButton component is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images.

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the dropdown button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, Dropdown button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of dropdown button.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of dropdown button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of dropdown button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the dropdown button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the dropdown button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the dropdown button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>.
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the dropdown button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the the action items with its properties which will be rendered in dropdown button popup.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> object. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Items</c> property is not specified, the dropdown button component is populated using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItems" /> and <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> tag directives. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the dropdown button is disabled or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the dropdown button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the custom element as action items which will be rendered in DropDownButton popup. The template content. The default value is null. If the Items property and tag directive is not specified, the DropDownButton component is populated using . In the below code example, a dropdown button component rendered with ListView component as . @code { public List Data = new List{ new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Print", Id = "data1" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Save As", Id = "data2" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Update Folder", Id = "data3" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Reply", Id = "data4" } }; public class ListData { public string Text { get; set; } public string Id { get; set; } public string Class { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as id, title etc. that will applied to the dropdown button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, dropdown button width has been specified as style attribute in SfButton tag directive. ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ProgressButtonAnimationSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation settings for the progress button.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the duration of the animation done in the progress button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a double value to set the duration of the animation of progress button. The default value is <c>400</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Easing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the animation timing function of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the progress UI is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the animation effect of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect.None" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideLeft</c>, the content will be moved with slide left  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideRight</c>, the content will be moved with slide right animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideUp</c>, the content will be moved with slide up animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideDown</c>, the content will be moved with slide down animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomIn</c>, the content will be moved with zoom in  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomOut</c>, the content will be moved with zoom out  animation 
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ProgressButtonSpinSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the spin settings for the progress button.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the spinner position of the progress button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ProgressButtonSpinSettings.Position" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Left</c>, the spinner will be placed left to the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Right</c>, the spinner will be placed right to the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Top</c>, the spinner will be placed above the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, spinner icon will be placed below the content of the progress button.

TagHelpers.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the custom element as action items which will be rendered in split button popup. The template content. The default value is null. If the Items property and tag directive is not specified, the dropdown button is populated using . In the below code example, a DropDownButton component rendered with ListView component as . @code { public List Data = new List{ new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Print", Id = "data1" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Save As", Id = "data2" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Update Folder", Id = "data3" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Reply", Id = "data4" } }; public class ListData { public string Text { get; set; } public string Id { get; set; } public string Class { get; set; } } } ]]>

Button content is either by specifying property or by specifying content within tag directive. In the below code example, a basic button is initialized with property. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of Button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the primary style for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>Before</c>, the label will be placed to the left side of the CheckBox. 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>After</c>, the icon will be placed to the right side of the CheckBox. 
            </remarks>

            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfCheckBox`1.Indeterminate" /> property overrides this <c>Checked</c> property in initial rendering of Checkbox.

TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor FAB Component (Floating Action Button) is an extension of that appears in front of all the contents of the page and performs the primary action. A simple FAB with text content. ]]> FAB with icon. ]]> FAB with icon and text. ]]> FAB with info button style. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to apply primary style for FAB. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is applied for FAB component. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the selector that points to an element in which the FAB will be positioned. The default value is null where FAB is positioned based on viewport of browser. The target element must have relative position, else FAB will get positioned based on the closest element which has relative position. Simple FAB with target. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the FAB is visible or hidden. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the FAB is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the position of the FAB relative to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" />. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of FAB. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition.BottomRight" />.
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            To refresh the position of FAB on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" /> resized, use <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.RefreshPositionAsync" /> method. 
            The position will be refreshed automatically when browser resized.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Media Query component allows developers to create responsive layouts. The component tracks changes in the browser size and notifies when the browser size matches the specified media query. The class is used to store information about each media query breakpoint, including the Breakpoint name and the MediaQuery itself. The property returns the Breakpoint of the MediaBreakpoint in the MediaBreakpoints collection that matches the current browser size. This allows developers to easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. Loading... } else { @if(activeBreakpoint == "Small") { } else { } } @code { private string activeBreakpoint; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActiveBreakpoint
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> in <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> collection that matches with the current browser size.
            Based on the <c>ActiveBreakpoint</c>, developers can easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A string value that represents the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> in <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> collection that matches with the browser size.
            The default value is <c>null</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaBreakpoints
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint" /> is set when a <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> matches with the current browser size from this collection.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            The defaul value is empty collection.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> is not specified, <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery" /> will use built-in collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Small" />, <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Medium" /> and <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Large" /> media queries.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ContentAlignment
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the alignment of message content. The available content alignments are Left, Center and Right.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.HorizontalAlign" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.HorizontalAlign.Left" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the CSS class or multiple classes separated by space that can be appended with the root element of the Message component to customize a message. The default value is String.Empty. The below code example shows border customization of the Message component. Conference Room no 01 / Building 135 10:00 AM - 10:30 AM ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Severity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the severity of the message, which is used to define the appearance (icons and colors) of the message. The available severity messages are <c>Normal</c>, <c>Info</c>, <c>Success</c>, <c>Warning</c> and <c>Error</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity.Normal" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show or hide the close icon in the Message component. The end user can click the close icon to hide the message. The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Closed" /> event triggered when message closed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the close icon for the Message component is visible at the top right corner of the Message component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show or hide the severity icon in the Message component. When set to true, the severity icon is displayed at the left edge of the Message component.
            This icon will be distinctive based on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Severity" /> property.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c> hides the severity icon in the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Variant
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the variant from predefined appearance variants to display the content of the Message component. The available variants are <c>Text</c>, <c>Outlined</c> and <c>Filled</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant.Text" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the visibility of the Message component. The Message component will be hidden when set to <c>false</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, hides the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback for the bound Visible property value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the Message component is closed (hided) successfully.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfSkeleton
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Skeleton is a placeholder that animates a shimmer effect to let users know that the pages content is loading at the moment. In other terms, it simulates the layout of page content while loading the actual content. The `Width` property will be prioritize and used as dimension for Circle and Square . Skeleton with default text shape. ]]> Skeleton with rectangle . ]]> Skeleton with fade effect . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that defines the width of the Skeleton. Accept the CSS units as string value. The default value is null. The property will be prioritize and used as dimension when is `Circle` and `Square`. Skeleton with `50px` radius applied for . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that defines the height of the Skeleton. Accept the CSS units as string value. The default value is null. Not required to define this property when is `Circle` and `Square`. Skeleton with `10px` height applied for . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the visibility state of the Skeleton. true, if the Skeleton is in visible state; otherwise, false. The default value is true. Skeleton rendered with hidden state. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Shape
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the shape of the Skeleton.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType.Text" />.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType" /> is<see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType.Circle" /> or<see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType.Square" />, the width property value will be prioritize and used as dimension when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfSkeleton.Shape" /> is Circle and Square.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Provides data to configure the Toast button properties.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the click event binding of action buttons created within Toast.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the text `Content` of the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space in the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is `Disabled`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Positions the icon before or after the text content in the Button.
            The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content.
            Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`.
            When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the type of the button.
            Possible values are Button, Submit, and Reset.
            </summary>

            Specifies the duration to animate.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Easing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation timing function.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the toast.
            If the user sets Fade animation, the toast will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the toast:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfToast
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content to be displayed on the Toast.
            Accepts selectors, string values and HTML elements.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of Toast component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled for the component. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ExtendedTimeout
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Toast display time duration after interacting with the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the height of the Toast in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>auto</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Icon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines CSS classes to specify an icon for the Toast which is to be displayed at top left corner of the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NewestOnTop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the newly created Toast message display order while multiple toast's are added to page one after another.
            By default, newly added Toast will be added after old Toast's.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the new toast will be added after old toast's. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ProgressDirection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Specifies the direction for the Toast progressBar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show the close button in Toast message to close the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the close button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowProgressBar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show the progress bar to denote the Toast message display timeout.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the progress bar should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the target container where the Toast to be displayed.
            Based on the target, the positions such as `Left`, `Top` will be applied to the Toast.
            The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ContentTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be displayed as a Toast content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Timeout
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Toast display time duration on the page in milliseconds.
            - Once the time expires, Toast message will be removed.
            - Setting 0 as a time out value displays the Toast on the page until the user closes it manually.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value. The default value is <c>5000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Title
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the title to be displayed on the Toast.
            Works only with string values.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Toast in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.
            In mobile devices, default width is considered as `100%`.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the unique identifier.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the Toast.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="T">Specifies the type of CalendarBase.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: T
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter T for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum allowable date or time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ID of the component.

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence

<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property is persisted.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="T">Specifies the type of CalendarBase.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: T
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter T for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum allowable date or time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder" /> property is used to set the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder in an input field until the user enters a value. 
            It can be used to provide additional context or instructions to the user about the format that is expected for the input.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             The <c>MaskPlaceholder</c> class properties will work when enabling the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.EnableMask" /> property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

            </item>

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Month
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the month segment of date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the month segment being the <c>mm</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Month" /> property might be set to <c>mm</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the month that they should enter.
            </remarks>

            </summary>
