            The DatePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowEdit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.AllowEdit" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows user to change the value via typing. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker allows user to change the value via typing; otherwise, <c>false</c>  user to change the value via picker only. The default value is <c>true</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullScreen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FullScreen" /> this indicates whether to enable full screen layout for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component popup in mobile devices or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, enable full screen layout for popup in mobile devices; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FullScreen" /> property applicable for mobile and tablet devices only.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableMask
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets mask rendering in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component render with mask format; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable mask property restricts the user to type the unwanted characters in the text area. It allows only eligible characters to type.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the behavior of the DatePicker that the text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values. Possible values are: Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available. Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker. Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it. A value of the enum representing the behavior of the floating label in the DatePicker. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> of the value that to be displayed in component.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>M/d/yyyy</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the additional such as styles, class, and more to the root element. A dictionary containing additional html attributes such as styles, class and more to the root element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying an inline attribute or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select a Date" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.InputAttributes" /> such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary containing additional input attributes such as disabled, value and more to the root element.
            </value>
            <remarks>       
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> until the user focuses or enter a value in DatePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>
            </value>
            <remarks> 
             The property is depending on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> property.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ZIndex" /> value of the DatePicker popup element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the DatePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum allowable date or time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ID of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A string representing the identifier of the component.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The ID property allows you to uniquely identify the component in the rendered HTML markup.
            If you don't set a custom ID, the component's ID will be auto-generated, and it
            may not be as descriptive as you require.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The current value of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Event callback
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation should be performed on each input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if validation should be performed on each input; otherwise, <c>false</c>.The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The <c>ValueChange</c> event will be fired after the component lost its focus.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value>
            The floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker.
            </value>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateTimePicker<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The DateTimePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the type of SfDateTimePicker.</typeparam>
            <summary>
            The DateTimePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows to select a date and time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateTimePicker<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ScrollTo
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the scroll bar position, if there is no value is selected in the DateTimePicker popup list or
            the given value is not present in the DateTimePicker popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A DateTime value is set to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateTimePicker`1.ScrollTo" /> property. If there is no value is selected in the popup list or the given value is not present in the popup list.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum time value that can be allowed to select in DateTimePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The DateTime value that represents the maximum time that can be selected in the DateTimePicker.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the minimum time value that can be allowed to select in DateTimePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The DateTime value that represents the minimum time that can be selected in the DateTimePicker.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Step
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the time interval between the two adjacent time values in the time popup list .
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value that specifies the time interval between two adjacent time values in the time popup list. The default value is <c>30</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TimeFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the format of the time value that to be displayed in time popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts time format value as string type. The default value is "".
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnKeyDown
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets keydown.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowEdit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.AllowEdit" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows user to change the value via typing. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker allows user to change the value via typing; otherwise, <c>false</c>  user to change the value via picker only. The default value is <c>true</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullScreen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FullScreen" /> this indicates whether to enable full screen layout for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component popup in mobile devices or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, enable full screen layout for popup in mobile devices; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FullScreen" /> property applicable for mobile and tablet devices only.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableMask
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets mask rendering in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component render with mask format; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable mask property restricts the user to type the unwanted characters in the text area. It allows only eligible characters to type.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the behavior of the DatePicker that the text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values. Possible values are: Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available. Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker. Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it. A value of the enum representing the behavior of the floating label in the DatePicker. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> of the value that to be displayed in component.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>M/d/yyyy</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the additional such as styles, class, and more to the root element. A dictionary containing additional html attributes such as styles, class and more to the root element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying an inline attribute or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select a Date" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.InputAttributes" /> such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary containing additional input attributes such as disabled, value and more to the root element.
            </value>
            <remarks>       
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> until the user focuses or enter a value in DatePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>
            </value>
            <remarks> 
             The property is depending on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> property.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ZIndex" /> value of the DatePicker popup element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the DatePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ID of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A string representing the identifier of the component.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The ID property allows you to uniquely identify the component in the rendered HTML markup.
            If you don't set a custom ID, the component's ID will be auto-generated, and it
            may not be as descriptive as you require.

            </item>

            </item>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> behavior of the TextBox that the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Placeholder" /> text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation: Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder based on the specified format until the user enters a value in the The TimePickerMaskPlaceholder class properties will work when enabling the property. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Month
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the month segment of date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the month segment being the <c>mm</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Month" /> property might be set to <c>mm</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the month that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Year
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the year segment of date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the year segment being the <c>yyyy</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Year" /> property might be set to <c>yyyy</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the year that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Hour
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the hour segment of datetime input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm</c>, with the hour segment being the <c>hh</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Hour" /> property might be set to <c>hh</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the hour that they should enter.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Calendar base is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The Calendar base is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Soecifies the type of CalendarBaseRender.</typeparam>

            The Calendar base is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.Internal.CalendarBaseRender<TValue> component.

            Specifies the option to enable the multiple dates selection of the calendar.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the cell click event.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum allowable date or time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>

            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ID of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A string representing the identifier of the component.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The ID property allows you to uniquely identify the component in the rendered HTML markup.
            If you don't set a custom ID, the component's ID will be auto-generated, and it
            may not be as descriptive as you require.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The current value of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Event callback
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation should be performed on each input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if validation should be performed on each input; otherwise, <c>false</c>.The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The <c>ValueChange</c> event will be fired after the component lost its focus.
            </remarks>

            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation should be performed on each input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if validation should be performed on each input; otherwise, <c>false</c>.The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The <c>ValueChange</c> event will be fired after the component lost its focus.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.Internal.CalendarTableHeader<TCalendarHeader>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Calendar day is show in header.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TCalendarHeader">Specifies the type of CalendarTableHeader.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TCalendarHeader
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TCalendarHeader for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.Internal.CalendarTableHeader<TCalendarHeader> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarRenderView
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the calendar view .
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum allowable date or time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

<summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications.
            It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HttpClientInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used  by DataManager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Url
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
            </summary>
            <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
            Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
            To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.SfDataManager" /> component.
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
            <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
            <description>
            ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
            <description> GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL service.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: GraphQLAdaptorOptions
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or Sets the properties to be specified for GraphQLAdaptor.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataAdaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Holds adaptor instance.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: InsertUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the insert URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl.
            If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: RemoveUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the remove URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl.
            If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: UpdateUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the update URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl.
            If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CrudUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CRUD URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl.
            If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: BatchUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the batch url.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl.
            If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Json
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the IEnumerable collection. This data could be queried and manipulated.
            </summary>

            Users can also send authentication bearer token using Headers property.

<summary>
            Specifies the jsonp request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the data type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Offline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables offline mode in datamanager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Applicable for remote data source. If offline is true then initial request will be made to fetch
            data. Further actions will be handled at the in-memory data and no more request will be made to the service.
            Cached data is stored in the JSON property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sepcifies requires format.
            </summary>

<summary>

            </summary>
            <exclude />

            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
            <description> GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL service.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
A class used for configuring the animation properties in the . In the following example, change the animation effect and delay time while opening the dialog.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Delay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds before the animation begins.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation delay is used for showing or hiding the dialog.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation duration for showing or hiding the dialog. The default value is <c>400</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the name of the animation that should be used when opening and closing the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" />.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation effect for showing or hiding the dialog.
            </value>        
            <remarks>
            If the Fade animation is enabled, the dialogwill open with the 'FadeIn' effect and close with the 'FadeOut' effect.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton
TagHelpers.Documentation:
A class used for configuring the button properties in the component. In the following code example, a basic DialogButton has been rendered using the tag directive.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private void OnBtnClick() { this.Visibility = false; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, the button is rendered using the property.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content specified within the tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. 
            The string content is also specified using the property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of button element. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right-to-left direction for the button.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right-to-left direction is enabled for the button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the primary style for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets an event callback that is triggered when the button is clicked. The event is triggered for UI-based clicks only.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private void OnBtnClick() { this.Visibility = false; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of button. Possible values are: Button Perform a standard button click action. Submit Sends form data to a server for processing. Reset Reset the filled values of a form to its initial values. One of the enumeration. The default value is

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private void OnBtnClick() { this.Visibility = false; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsFlat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable or disable the flat appearance of the dialog buttons.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the flat appearence is enabled for dialog button. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element.
