TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Blazor Dialog is a user interface (UI) component that displays critical information, errors, warnings, and questions to users, as well as confirms decisions and collects input from the users.
            Based on user interactions, the dialog is classified as modal or non-modal (modeless).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the dialog element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties values are persisted
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the child content of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragging
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component can be dragged by the user. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dragging is enabled for dialog component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can reposition the dialog by clicking and dragging the header. You can only drag the dialog within the container element.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseOnEscape
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component can be closed on pressing the escape <c>(ESC)</c> key.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog closing by pressing the escap key. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the value that can be displayed in the content section of the component. The content displayed in the dialog component.The default value is string.Empty. @code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string DialogContent { get; set; } = "

Dialog content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom classes to customize the component. If we set the css class, then the custom class is applied for dialog. The default value is string.Empty.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableResize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the user can resize the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can't able to resize the dialog below the value specified in the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.MinHeight" /> property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ResizeHandles
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the resize handles direction in the component that the user can resize. You can set the resize direction for dialog component. The default value is new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.SouthEast }. To resize the dialog in a specific direction, enable .

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private ResizeDirection[] ResizeHandles { get; set; } protected override void OnInitialized() { ResizeHandles = new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.NorthEast }; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dialog component. The default value is `false`. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of footer area. The action buttons are enabled by default in the footer. The default value is `string.Empty`. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the tag will be disabled.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string FoooterTemplate { get; set; } = "

Footer content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of title area. string.Empty, if dialog will be displayed without the header. The default value is `string.Empty`.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string HeaderTemplate { get; set; } = "

Header content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the height value, then the dialog will render based on specified height otherwise the default height value `auto` is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsModal
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> can be displayed as modal.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the modal dialog is enabled. The default value is `false`. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            <c>Modal</c>: It creates an overlay that prevents interaction with the parent application and the user.
            <c>Modeless</c>: It does not prevent the user from interacting with the parent application.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the min-height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the min-height value, then the dialog will render based on specified min-height. The default value is string.Empty. The dialog's minimum height can be adjusted using the MinHeight property. The dialog size will be limited to the MinHeight setting if the user attempts to resize it below this threshold.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the close icon can be displayed in the dialog's title section.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the close icon in dialog component is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target element in which the should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element. You can use this property to specify the CSS selector.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog will be open at initially. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the width of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the width value, then the dialog will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value 100% is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ZIndex that determines whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> is displayed in front of or behind another component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The dialog will display in front of other component. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
             Set the ZIndex to the dialog by obtaining all of the ZIndex elements from a page and calculating the maximum ZIndex.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowPrerender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether the component re-render or not when the dialog gets open. true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false. Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Blazor Dialog is a user interface (UI) component that displays critical information, errors, warnings, and questions to users, as well as confirms decisions and collects input from the users.
            Based on user interactions, the dialog is classified as modal or non-modal (modeless).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the dialog element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties values are persisted
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragging
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component can be dragged by the user. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dragging is enabled for dialog component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can reposition the dialog by clicking and dragging the header. You can only drag the dialog within the container element.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseOnEscape

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableResize

Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of footer area. The action buttons are enabled by default in the footer. The default value is `string.Empty`. The default value is string.Empty. The dialog's minimum height can be adjusted using the MinHeight property. The dialog size will be limited to the MinHeight setting if the user attempts to resize it below this threshold.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogProvider
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            DialogProvider is a target element where the built-in dialogs are shown using <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.ConfirmAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" />,
            <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.AlertAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> and <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.PromptAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> 
            methods that are appended to this element. 
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            It is recommended to add this component in `MainLayout.razor` to show utility dialogs from anywhere in the application.
            If you add this to any particular page, the utility dialogs can then be displayed only for that page.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip
TagHelpers.Documentation: The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element. The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element. The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element. The SfTooltip component displays a tooltip that appears as a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element. The SfTooltip component can be customized with various properties such as content, position, and animation. The Tooltip can be triggered by various events including hover, click and focus. The component can be used to provide additional context or information about an element on a web page. ]]> The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the Tooltip component is closed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This event is useful for performing additional actions when the Tooltip is closed, such as updating the UI or performing cleanup tasks.
            The event callback function takes a TooltipEventArgs parameter, which provides information about the Tooltip that was closed.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the Tooltip component is opened.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This event is useful for performing additional actions when the Tooltip is opened, such as updating the UI or tracking user interactions.
            The event callback function takes a TooltipEventArgs parameter, which provides information about the Tooltip that was opened.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the Tooltip hides from the screen.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This event is useful for performing additional actions before the Tooltip is closed, such as updating the UI or validating user input.
            The event callback function takes a TooltipEventArgs parameter, which provides information about the Tooltip that is about to be closed.
            To prevent the Tooltip from closing, set the cancel property of the TooltipEventArgs parameter to true.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised for every collision fit calculation.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This event is useful for fine-tuning the placement of the Tooltip on the screen and avoiding overlaps with other UI elements.
            The event callback function takes a TooltipEventArgs parameter, which provides information about the Tooltip and its placement.
            The TooltipEventArgs parameter includes the target element and collisionInfo object, which describe the Tooltip's position and collision detection results.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This event is useful for customizing the Tooltip's appearance or behavior before it is displayed.
            The event callback function takes a TooltipEventArgs parameter, which provides information about the Tooltip and its target element.
            The TooltipEventArgs parameter includes the target element and an optional cancel argument, which can be set to true to prevent the Tooltip from being displayed.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the Tooltip and its contents will be added to the DOM.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page.
            This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen.
            For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised after the Tooltip component is created.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the Tooltip component is destroyed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the content which has to be passed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ContentTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Gets or sets the template that defines the content of the component.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The ContentTemplate is a RenderFragment that allows developers to customize the appearance and content of the component. 
            This property can be used to define custom HTML or Razor markup to be rendered as the content of the component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the animation settings for the opening and closing of the Tooltip. The animation property allows you to customize the animation of the Tooltip component, including the delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice. You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state. @code { public AnimationModel Animation { get; set; } = new AnimationModel { Open = new TooltipAnimationSettings {Delay = 0, Duration = 500, Effect = Effect.ZoomIn }, Close = new TooltipAnimationSettings{Delay=0,Duration=500,Effect=Effect.ZoomOut} }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds before the Tooltip closes. The CloseDelay property is used to specify the delay in milliseconds before the Tooltip closes. If no delay is needed, the default value of 0 can be used. Accepts a double value representing the delay in milliseconds. The default value is 0. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the content of the Tooltip component. The Content property is used to specify the content of the Tooltip component as a string element. Accepts a string value representing the content of the Tooltip component. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the CSS classes to be applied to the Tooltip component. The CssClass property is used to apply custom CSS class names that define specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element. Multiple class names can be specified by separating them with a space. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of the component. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable or disable the rendering of the component in right-to-left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The EnableRtl property is used to render the Tooltip component from right to left direction.
            </remarks>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled; Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: WindowCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether to set the collision target element as the page viewport (window) or the Tooltip element, when using the target.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The WindowCollision property is used to enable or disable the collision calculation between the target elements and viewport (window) instead of the Tooltip element. 
            If the value is set to <c>true</c>, the collision will be calculated between the target and the viewport (window). Otherwise, the collision will be calculated between the target and the Tooltip element.
            </remarks>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the window collision can be enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the height of the Tooltip component. The Height property is used to specify the height of the Tooltip component. If no height is specified, the Tooltip height will be set based on its content. When the content of the Tooltip exceeds the height value, the scroll mode will be enabled. The value can be any valid CSS height value, such as "100px" or "50%". Accepts the string value. The default value is auto. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsSticky
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Tooltip should be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually.
             </summary>
             <remarks>
             The IsSticky property is used to set the behavior of the Tooltip when it is displayed.
             If the value is set to true, the Tooltip will be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually, regardless of the user interaction that triggered the Tooltip. 
             If the value is set to false, the Tooltip will be displayed for a specified duration based on the Animation property and then automatically closed.
            </remarks>
             <value>
             <c>true</c>, if the Tooltip should be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
             </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MouseTrail
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables or disables the ability for the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer as it moves over the specified target element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Tooltip should be shown when the mouse pointer moves over the specific target. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetX
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the X-axis offset between the target and Tooltip element. A double value representing the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetY
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in the Y-axis. Accepts a double value representing the space between the target and Tooltip element in the Y-axis. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the delay time in milliseconds for opening the Tooltip after the user hovers over the target element. A double value representing the delay time in milliseconds. The default value is 0, which means that the Tooltip opens immediately after the user hovers over the target element. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpensOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Determines the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content. The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom. Accepts the string value. The default value is Auto. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation: To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element. A value of the enumeration that specifies the position of Tooltip element. The default value is . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTipPointer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the tip pointer should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed. A string value representing the target selector. The target element is considered as the parent container. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Container
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the container element in which the Tooltip's pop-up will be appended. A string value that represents the container element selector. The default value is body". ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TipPointerPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation: It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End. When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside. A value of the enumeration that specifies the position of the tip pointer. The default value is . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation: To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen. Accepts the string value.The default value is auto. ]]>

            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page.
            This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen.
            For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised after the Tooltip component is created.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the Tooltip component is destroyed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the content which has to be passed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ContentTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Gets or sets the template that defines the content of the component.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The ContentTemplate is a RenderFragment that allows developers to customize the appearance and content of the component. 
            This property can be used to define custom HTML or Razor markup to be rendered as the content of the component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the animation settings for the opening and closing of the Tooltip. The animation property allows you to customize the animation of the Tooltip component, including the delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice. You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state. @code { public AnimationModel Animation { get; set; } = new AnimationModel { Open = new TooltipAnimationSettings {Delay = 0, Duration = 500, Effect = Effect.ZoomIn }, Close = new TooltipAnimationSettings{Delay=0,Duration=500,Effect=Effect.ZoomOut} }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds before the Tooltip closes. The CloseDelay property is used to specify the delay in milliseconds before the Tooltip closes. If no delay is needed, the default value of 0 can be used. Accepts a double value representing the delay in milliseconds. The default value is 0. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the content of the Tooltip component. The Content property is used to specify the content of the Tooltip component as a string element. Accepts a string value representing the content of the Tooltip component. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the CSS classes to be applied to the Tooltip component. The CssClass property is used to apply custom CSS class names that define specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element. Multiple class names can be specified by separating them with a space. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of the component. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable or disable the rendering of the component in right-to-left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The EnableRtl property is used to render the Tooltip component from right to left direction.
            </remarks>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled; Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: WindowCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether to set the collision target element as the page viewport (window) or the Tooltip element, when using the target.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The WindowCollision property is used to enable or disable the collision calculation between the target elements and viewport (window) instead of the Tooltip element. 
            If the value is set to <c>true</c>, the collision will be calculated between the target and the viewport (window). Otherwise, the collision will be calculated between the target and the Tooltip element.
            </remarks>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the window collision can be enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the height of the Tooltip component. The Height property is used to specify the height of the Tooltip component. If no height is specified, the Tooltip height will be set based on its content. When the content of the Tooltip exceeds the height value, the scroll mode will be enabled. The value can be any valid CSS height value, such as "100px" or "50%". Accepts the string value. The default value is auto. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsSticky
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Tooltip should be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually.
             </summary>
             <remarks>
             The IsSticky property is used to set the behavior of the Tooltip when it is displayed.
             If the value is set to true, the Tooltip will be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually, regardless of the user interaction that triggered the Tooltip. 
             If the value is set to false, the Tooltip will be displayed for a specified duration based on the Animation property and then automatically closed.
            </remarks>
             <value>
             <c>true</c>, if the Tooltip should be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
             </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MouseTrail
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables or disables the ability for the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer as it moves over the specified target element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Tooltip should be shown when the mouse pointer moves over the specific target. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetX
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the X-axis offset between the target and Tooltip element. A double value representing the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetY
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in the Y-axis. Accepts a double value representing the space between the target and Tooltip element in the Y-axis. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the delay time in milliseconds for opening the Tooltip after the user hovers over the target element. A double value representing the delay time in milliseconds. The default value is 0, which means that the Tooltip opens immediately after the user hovers over the target element. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpensOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Determines the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content. The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom. Accepts the string value. The default value is Auto. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation: To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element. A value of the enumeration that specifies the position of Tooltip element. The default value is . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTipPointer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the tip pointer should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed. A string value representing the target selector. The target element is considered as the parent container. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Container
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the container element in which the Tooltip's pop-up will be appended. A string value that represents the container element selector. The default value is body". ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TipPointerPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation: It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End. When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside. A value of the enumeration that specifies the position of the tip pointer. The default value is . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation: To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen. Accepts the string value.The default value is auto. ]]>

<summary>

            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before fetching data from the data source.
            </summary>

<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data fetch request fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the suggestions popup before it opens Prevent the suggestions popup open action using . @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnOpenHandler(BeforeOpenEventArgs args) { args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Blur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the AutoComplete component loses focus.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the property changed. This event triggers when an item in a popup is selected or when the user changes the model value. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnChange(Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ChangeEventArgs args) { var NewValue = args.Value; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the suggestions popup is closed. Prevent the suggestions popup close action using and the popup remains opened always. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnCloseHandler(PopupEventArgs args) { args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed

            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Filtering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the AutoComplete. Prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modified data source and query in the method. @code{ SfAutoComplete AutoCompleteObj { get; set; } protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) { args.PreventDefaultAction = true; var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true }); await AutoCompleteObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Focus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the component is the focus.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnValueSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when an item is selected from the suggestions popup by the user either with a mouse tap or with a keyboard navigation. Prevent the item selection action using . @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnSelectHandler(SelectEventArgs args) { if(args.ItemData== "Medium") args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The AutoComplete component provides the matched suggestion list when type into the input, from which the user can select one.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The AutoComplete component provides the matched suggestion list when type into the input, from which the user can select one.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Highlight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the searched characters on the suggested list items should highlight matched portions of the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the searched characters should be highlighted; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the minimum length of input characters required for the search action to perform suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the minimum length of search characters. The default value is <c>1</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the type of filtering to be applied for the AutoComplete items.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The default filter type is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.FilterType.Contains" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the AutoComplete should display a clear button to clear the selected value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the clear button is visible; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When the clear button is clicked, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" />, and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Index" /> and properties are reset to <c>null</c>. This allows users to clear the selected value and start fresh easily.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowPopupButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the popup button should be displayed in the AutoComplete.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the popup button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum number of suggestions list to be displayed in the AutoComplete dropdown.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The default value is <c>20</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustom
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ComboBox allows custom values to be entered.
            </summary>
            <value>
              <c>true</c> if custom values are allowed the user to enter a value that does not exist in the data source; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autofill
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ComboBox automatically fills the input with the first matched item while typing.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if autofill is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ComboBox should perform validation when input is entered.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if input validation is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ComboBoxEvents`2.ValueChange" /> event will be fired after the component loses its focus.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the unique identifier for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can specify only unique value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an expression that identifies the bound value in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the drop-down list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Dropdown list component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType" /> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> is in read-only mode or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. This will be used with two-way binding.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. The default is <c>null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Use the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property to specify or determine the value displayed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback that trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size - @(context) @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the dropdown list in pixels or percentage value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component in the tab order.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The numeric index of the dropdown list in the tab order. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the drop-down list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Dropdown list component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType" /> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> is in read-only mode or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. This will be used with two-way binding.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. The default is <c>null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Use the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property to specify or determine the value displayed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback that trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An event callback function.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size - @(context) @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the dropdown list in pixels or percentage value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component in the tab order.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The numeric index of the dropdown list in the tab order. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>
