The below code example, showcases a . value )" ValueChanged="@((string[] v) => value = v)" DataSource="@vehicleData" TValue="string[]" TItem="ListItem"> @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MentionFieldSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The MentionFieldSettings class is a configuration class that is used to specify which fields in a data source should be used for different aspects of a mention list, For example, you can use this class to specify which fields in a data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, as well as an optional field for grouping items. This allows the mention list to be populated with data from the specified data source, making it easier for users to select items from the list. This can be useful in scenarios where users need to select items from a large or complex data set, such as selecting names from a list of contacts or selecting products from a catalog. In this example, the MentionFieldSettings class is used to specify that the Text and ID fields in the data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, respectively.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupBy
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>. 
            This is optional and does not have to be specified if you do not want to group items in the mention list. 
            If you do not specify a <c>GroupBy</c>, all items in the mention list will be displayed in a single, ungrouped list.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention<TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can select or tag one. Enter the in the editable element and tag the any item from the suggestion list.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]> Specifies the type of data source. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. The selected item inserted in target in a predefined highlight format. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list.

            </summary>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target selector for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. An element on the page should be used as the target for the SfMention component, so that mention component displays suggestion list opens relative to the elements cursor position. The Target property is required and must be specified.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

            </value>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the component. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include for popup element. The default value is String.Empty.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the symbol or single character which triggers the search action in the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. A character of symbol. By default, the trigger character is the @ symbol..
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowMentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MentionChar" /> along with with the text when displaying selected mention item in target.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the selected mention item displayed along with the mention character. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <c>ShowMentionChar</c> is set to <c>true</c>, the <c>mention</c> component will display the mention character along with the text of the mentioned item. 
            For example, if the mention character is <c>@</c> and the user mentions the item "John Doe", the mention will be displayed as @John Doe.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the filter type that specifies the match criteria while searching for mentions. The possible values for the property are: StartsWith lists the items if the start of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. EndsWith lists the items if the end of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. Contains lists the items if the item text contains the search term or input string. One of the enumeration that specifies the match criteria while searching. The default value is .
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowSpaces
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to continue search action if user enter space after mention character while searching.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the search action takes place even after a space, if the DataSource data's are matched. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            By default, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1" /> component will only search for mentions when the mention character is immediately followed by a non-whitespace character (e.g. @john but not @ john). 
            However, you can change this behavior and allow the SfMention component to continue searching for mentions even if the user enters a space after the mention character by setting the <c>AllowSpaces</c> property to true.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuffixText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor. Accepts as string value. The default value is String.Empty. When a item is selected, the component will automatically insert the text of the mentioned item into the target editor. By default, the mention component will insert the text of the mentioned item without any additional text or characters. However, you can specify a custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The default value is 25. By default, the component will display all of the items in the suggestions list. However, you can limit the number of items that are displayed in the list by setting the property.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the minimum length of user input that is required to initiate the search action. The minimum number of characters user input that is required to initiate the search action.The default value is 0. By default, the component will initiate a search as soon as the user begins typing in the editable element. You can change this behavior by setting the property. For example, if you wanted to require the user to enter at least 3 characters before a search is initiated, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Highlight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to highlight the searched characters on suggestion list items.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, enable the highlighting of the searched characters in the suggestions list. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the popup's height value in pixels/number/percentage. If a number value is specified, it will be treated as pixels. Accepts property accepts a value in pixels, number, or percentage. The default value is 300px. For example, if you wanted to set the height of the popup to 200 pixels, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the popup's width value in pixels/number/percentage. If a number value is specified, it will be treated as pixels. Accepts property accepts a value in pixels, number, or percentage. The default value is auto. For example, if you wanted to set the width of the popup to 250 pixels, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SpinnerTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of the loading initiator in the popup. This template is displayed until the data for the suggestions has been loaded. The template content. The default value is null.
@code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: DisplayTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that defines how the selected value will be displayed in the editable component. The TItem" is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the suggested item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null.
@@@((context as EmployeeData).FirstName) @code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TargetComponent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target component for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target component displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. The template content. The default value is null. is attached to the first element of the TargetComponent.
@code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); } ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention<TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can select or tag one. Enter the in the editable element and tag the any item from the suggestion list.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]> Specifies the type of data source. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. The selected item inserted in target in a predefined highlight format. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list.

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target selector for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. An element on the page should be used as the target for the SfMention component, so that mention component displays suggestion list opens relative to the elements cursor position. The Target property is required and must be specified.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the component. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include for popup element. The default value is String.Empty.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the symbol or single character which triggers the search action in the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. A character of symbol. By default, the trigger character is the @ symbol..
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowMentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MentionChar" /> along with with the text when displaying selected mention item in target.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the selected mention item displayed along with the mention character. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <c>ShowMentionChar</c> is set to <c>true</c>, the <c>mention</c> component will display the mention character along with the text of the mentioned item. 
            For example, if the mention character is <c>@</c> and the user mentions the item "John Doe", the mention will be displayed as @John Doe.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the filter type that specifies the match criteria while searching for mentions. The possible values for the property are: StartsWith lists the items if the start of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. EndsWith lists the items if the end of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. Contains lists the items if the item text contains the search term or input string. One of the enumeration that specifies the match criteria while searching. The default value is .
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowSpaces
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to continue search action if user enter space after mention character while searching.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the search action takes place even after a space, if the DataSource data's are matched. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            By default, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1" /> component will only search for mentions when the mention character is immediately followed by a non-whitespace character (e.g. @john but not @ john). 
            However, you can change this behavior and allow the SfMention component to continue searching for mentions even if the user enters a space after the mention character by setting the <c>AllowSpaces</c> property to true.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuffixText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor. Accepts as string value. The default value is String.Empty. When a item is selected, the component will automatically insert the text of the mentioned item into the target editor. By default, the mention component will insert the text of the mentioned item without any additional text or characters. However, you can specify a custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The default value is 25. By default, the component will display all of the items in the suggestions list. However, you can limit the number of items that are displayed in the list by setting the property.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the minimum length of user input that is required to initiate the search action. The minimum number of characters user input that is required to initiate the search action.The default value is 0. By default, the component will initiate a search as soon as the user begins typing in the editable element. You can change this behavior by setting the property. For example, if you wanted to require the user to enter at least 3 characters before a search is initiated, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Filtering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the MultiSelect Dropdown search box. Prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modified data source and query in the method. @code{ SfMultiSelect MultiSelectObj { get; set; } protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) { args.PreventDefaultAction = true; var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true }); await MultiSelectObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query); } } ]]>

<summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>

            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the identifier of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect Dropdown component is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the MultiSelect Dropdown component is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component's state should be persisted between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if persistence is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect Dropdown component allows entering custom values.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if custom values are allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether virtualization is enabled for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if virtualization is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>..
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering an entire load of huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup based on the ItemsCount when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableVirtualization" /> is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the number of items to be fetched. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether filtering is allowed in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if filtering is allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the searching character does not match, the <c>NoRecordsTemplate</c> property value will be shown.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value change should occur on blur for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if value change occurs on blur; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dropdown should close automatically after selecting an item in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown should close on select; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the delimiter character used to separate selected items in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The delimiter character used for item separation. The default value is ",".
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the group checkbox is enabled in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the group checkbox is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selection order is enabled in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selection order can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the placeholder text displayed in the filter bar of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The placeholder text for the filter bar.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the type of floating label to be displayed in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Possible values are:
            <c>Never</c>: Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
            <c>Always</c>: The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
            <c>Auto</c>: The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering the value in it.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selected item should be hidden in the popup list of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the selected item should be hidden; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the HTML attributes to be applied to the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The HTML attributes as a dictionary.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional input attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum number of items that can be selected in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the maximum number of items that can be selected in the list. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the visual mode of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The visual mode of the MultiSelect Dropdown. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.VisualMode.Default" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dropdown should open when the MultiSelect component is clicked.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown should open on click; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the placeholder text to be displayed in the MultiSelect input when no items are selected.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the dropdown popup in the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the dropdown popup in the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect component is in read-only mode.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the MultiSelect component is read-only; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text to be displayed for the "Select All" option in the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect Dropdown should display a clear button to clear the selected values.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the clear button should be shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowDropDownIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dropdown icon should be shown in the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown icon should be shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowSelectAll
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>

            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

            </value>

<summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>

            </summary>

            </summary>

            <typeparam name="TItem">Specifies the type of SfMultiSelect.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the identifier of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect Dropdown component is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the MultiSelect Dropdown component is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component's state should be persisted between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if persistence is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the MultiSelect Dropdown component allows entering custom values.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if custom values are allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether virtualization is enabled for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if virtualization is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>..
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering an entire load of huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup based on the ItemsCount when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableVirtualization" /> is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the number of items to be fetched. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether filtering is allowed in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if filtering is allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the searching character does not match, the <c>NoRecordsTemplate</c> property value will be shown.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value change should occur on blur for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if value change occurs on blur; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dropdown should close automatically after selecting an item in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown should close on select; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the delimiter character used to separate selected items in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The delimiter character used for item separation. The default value is ",".
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the group checkbox is enabled in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the group checkbox is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selection order is enabled in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selection order can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the placeholder text displayed in the filter bar of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The placeholder text for the filter bar.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the type of floating label to be displayed in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Possible values are:
            <c>Never</c>: Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
            <c>Always</c>: The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
            <c>Auto</c>: The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering the value in it.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selected item should be hidden in the popup list of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the selected item should be hidden; otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the HTML attributes to be applied to the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The HTML attributes as a dictionary.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional input attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum number of items that can be selected in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the maximum number of items that can be selected in the list. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the visual mode of the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The visual mode of the MultiSelect Dropdown. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.VisualMode.Default" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dropdown should open when the MultiSelect component is clicked.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown should open on click; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the placeholder text to be displayed in the MultiSelect input when no items are selected.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.CacheTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagHelper" /> implementation targeting <cache> elements.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: priority
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Memory.CacheItemPriority" /> policy for the cache entry.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a <see cref="T:System.String" /> to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of HTTP request headers to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of query parameters to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-route
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of route data parameters to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-cookie
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of cookie names to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-user
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that determines if the cached result is to be varied by the Identity for the logged in
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext.User" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-culture
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that determines if the cached result is to be varied by request culture.
            <para>
            Setting this to <c>true</c> would result in the result to be varied by <see cref="P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture" />
            and <see cref="P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture" />.
            </para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-on
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the exact <see cref="T:System.DateTimeOffset" /> the cache entry should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-after
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration, from the time the cache entry was added, when it should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-sliding
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration from last access that the cache entry should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value which determines if the tag helper is enabled or not.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <environment> elements that conditionally renders
            content based on the current value of <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            If the environment is not listed in the specified <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Names" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Include" />,
            or if it is in <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" />, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: names
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content should be rendered.
            If the current environment is also in the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" /> list, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content should be rendered.
            If the current environment is also in the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" /> list, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            </summary>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Value indicating if file version should be appended to the src urls.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            If <c>true</c> then a query string "v" with the encoded content of the file is added.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The format string (see <see href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx" />) used to format the
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.For" /> result. Sets the generated "value" attribute to that formatted string.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Not used if the provided (see <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" />) or calculated "type" attribute value is
            <c>checkbox</c>, <c>password</c>, or <c>radio</c>. That is, <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> is used when calling
            <see cref="M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.IHtmlGenerator.GenerateTextBox(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ViewContext,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExplorer,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Object)" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The type of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine the <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.IHtmlGenerator" />
            helper to call and the default <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> value. A default <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> is not calculated
            if the provided (see <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" />) or calculated "type" attribute value is <c>checkbox</c>,
            <c>hidden</c>, <c>password</c>, or <c>radio</c>.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The value of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine the generated "checked" attribute
            if <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" /> is "radio". Must not be <c>null</c> in that case.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LabelTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <label> elements with an <c>asp-for</c> attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <link> elements that supports fallback href paths.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The tag helper won't process for cases with just the 'href' attribute.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: href
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Address of the linked resource.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-href-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to load.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-href-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to exclude from loading.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.HrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The URL of a CSS stylesheet to fallback to in the case the primary one fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-suppress-fallback-integrity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Boolean value that determines if an integrity hash will be compared with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-append-version
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Value indicating if file version should be appended to the href urls.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            If <c>true</c> then a query string "v" with the encoded content of the file is added.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to fallback to in the case the primary
            one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to exclude from the fallback list, in
            the case the primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-class
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The class name defined in the stylesheet to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestProperty" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestValue" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-property
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The CSS property name to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestClass" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestValue" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The CSS property value to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestClass" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestProperty" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.OptionTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <option> elements.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            This <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> works in conjunction with <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper" />. It reads elements
            content but does not modify that content. The only modification it makes is to add a <c>selected</c> attribute
            in some cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value for the <option> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Renders a partial view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name or path of the partial view that is rendered to the response.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model. Cannot be used together with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.Model" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: model
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The model to pass into the partial view. Cannot be used together with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.For" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: optional
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            When optional, executing the tag helper will no-op if the view cannot be located.
            Otherwise will throw stating the view could not be found.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: fallback-name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            View to lookup if the view specified by <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.Name" /> cannot be located.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: view-data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ViewDataDictionary" /> to pass into the partial view.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PersistComponentStateTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            A <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagHelper" /> that saves the state of Razor components rendered on the page up to that point.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: persist-mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PersistComponentStateTagHelper.PersistenceMode" /> for the state to persist.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <script> elements that supports fallback src paths.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The tag helper won't process for cases with just the 'src' attribute.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: src
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Address of the external script to use.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-src-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to load.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-src-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to exclude from loading.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.SrcInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The URL of a Script tag to fallback to in the case the primary one fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-suppress-fallback-integrity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Boolean value that determines if an integrity hash will be compared with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.FallbackSrc" /> value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-append-version
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Value indicating if file version should be appended to src urls.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            A query string "v" with the encoded content of the file is added.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to fallback to in the case the
            primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to exclude from the fallback list, in
            the case the primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.FallbackSrcInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The script method defined in the primary script to use for the fallback test.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <select> elements with <c>asp-for</c> and/or
            <c>asp-items</c> attribute(s).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.SelectListItem" /> objects used to populate the <select> element with
            <optgroup> and <option> elements.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.TextAreaTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <textarea> elements with an <c>asp-for</c> attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.TextAreaTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationMessageTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting any HTML element with an <c>asp-validation-for</c>
            attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-validation-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets an expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationSummaryTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting any HTML element with an <c>asp-validation-summary</c>
            attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-validation-summary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If <see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.All" /> or <see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.ModelOnly" />, appends a validation
            summary. Otherwise (<see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.None" />, the default), this tag helper does nothing.
            </summary>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentException">
            Thrown if setter is called with an undefined <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationSummaryTagHelper.ValidationSummary" /> value e.g.
            <c>(ValidationSummary)23</c>.
            </exception>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.TagHelpers.UrlResolutionTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting elements containing attributes with URL expected values.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Resolves URLs starting with '~/' (relative to the application's 'webroot' setting) that are not
            targeted by other <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" />s. Runs prior to other <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" />s to ensure
            application-relative URLs are resolved.</remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Bind
TagHelpers.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributes.Name: @bind-...
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: format
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies a format to convert the value specified by the corresponding bind attribute. For example: @bind-value:format="..." will apply a format string to the value specified in @bind-value="...". The format string can currently only be used with expressions of type DateTime.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: event
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the event handler name to attach for change notifications for the value provided by the '@bind-...' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: culture
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the culture to use for conversions.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: get
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the expression to use for binding the value to the attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: set
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the expression to use for updating the bound value when a new value is available.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: after
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies an action to run after the new value has been set.
